data.title: 60+ Be Yourself Quotes to Celebrate Your Uniqueness
data.meta_description: Be yourself quotes - â€œThe snow goose need not bathe to make itself white. Neither need you do anything but be yourself.â€ â€• Lao Tzu
data.text:
You are special. You are worthy. You have a kind of magic that can never be imitated. You are a blessing. You are spectacular. You are most beautiful when you are yourself.

How did these words make you feel? I'm betting on the chance that they did something to your heart.

It feels wonderful when someone appreciates you for who you are just as you are, doesn't it? When they encourage you to be yourself more and love you for it.

We all deserve that. But, we deserve that most from our own selves. So, I'm glad you're here looking for words that will inspire you to be yourself. Here they are,

Be yourself quotes

â€œBe yourself; everyone else is already taken.â€

â€• Oscar Wilde

â€œBe who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind.â€

â€• Bernard M. Baruch

â€œImperfection is beauty, madness is genius and it's better to be absolutely ridiculous than absolutely boring.â€

â€• Marilyn Monroe

â€œTo be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment.â€

â€• Ralph Waldo Emerson

â€œYou may not control all the events that happen to you, but you can decide not to be reduced by them.â€

â€• Maya Angelou

These self-love affirmations will help you greatly embrace yourself just as you are :)

â€œFollow your heart, listen to your inner voice, stop caring about what others think.â€

â€• Roy T. Bennett

â€œFollow your inner moonlight; don't hide the madness.â€

â€• Allen Ginsberg

â€œA girl should be two things: who and what she wants.â€

â€• Coco Chanel

â€œBe your own celebrity. Chase your own self. You are worth infinite treasures of this planet.â€

â€• Hiral Nagda

â€œDonâ€™t sell yourself short; you are your best asset.â€

â€• Matshona Dhliwayo

â€œDon't compromise yourself - you're all you have.â€

â€• John Grisham

â€œTo shine your brightest light is to be who you truly are.â€

â€• Roy T. Bennett

â€œWhen you are content to be simply yourself and don't compare or compete, everyone will respect you.â€

â€• Lao Tzu

â€œNever be bullied into silence. Never allow yourself to be made a victim. Accept no one's definition of your life, but define yourself.â€

â€• Harvey Fierstein

â€œLet yourself be drawn by the stronger pull of that which you truly love.â€

â€• Rumi

â€œDon't you ever let a soul in the world tell you that you can't be exactly who you are.â€

â€• Lady Gaga

â€œYou were born to stand out, stop trying to fit in.â€

â€• Roy T. Bennett

â€œMake the most of yourself....for that is all there is of you.â€

â€• Ralph Waldo Emerson

â€œJust be yourself, there is no one better.â€

â€• Taylor Swift

â€œYou are unique. You have different talents and abilities. You donâ€™t have to always follow in the footsteps of others. And most importantly, you should always remind yourself that you don't have to do what everyone else is doing and have a responsibility to develop the talents you have been given.â€

â€• Roy T. Bennett

â€œNever dull your shine for somebody else.â€

â€• Tyra Banks

â€œThe easiest thing to be in the world is you. The most difficult thing to be is what other people want you to be. Don't let them put you in that position.â€

â€• Leo Buscaglia

â€œThere is a vitality, a life force, an energy, a quickening that is translated through you into action, and because there is only one of you in all time, this expression is unique. And if you block it, it will never exist through any other medium and will be lost.â€

â€• Martha Graham

â€œThe more you try to crush your true nature, the more it will control you. Be what you are. No one who really loves you will stop.â€

â€• Cassandra Clare

â€œYou are you. Now, isn't that pleasant?â€

â€• Dr. Seuss

â€œIf you don't know who you truly are, you'll never know what you really want.â€

â€• Roy T. Bennett

â€œDo the things that interest you and do them with all your heart. Don't be concerned about whether people are watching you or criticizing you. The chances are that they aren't paying any attention to you. It's your attention to yourself that is so stultifying. But you have to disregard yourself as completely as possible. If you fail the first time then you'll just have to try harder the second time. After all, there's no real reason why you should fail. Just stop thinking about yourself.â€

â€• Eleanor Roosevelt

â€œEvery morning when I wake up, I experience an exquisite joy â€”the joy of being Salvador DalÃ­â€” and I ask myself in rapture: What wonderful things is this Salvador DalÃ­ going to accomplish today?â€

â€• Salvador DalÃ­

â€œThe snow goose need not bathe to make itself white. Neither need you do anything but be yourself.â€

â€• Lao Tzu

â€œYou don't need anybody to tell you who you are or what you are. You are what you are!â€

â€• John Lennon

â€œAlways be yourself, express yourself, have faith in yourself, do not go out and look for a successful personality and duplicate it.â€

â€• Bruce Lee

â€œWe must not allow other peopleâ€™s limited perceptions to define us.â€

â€• Virginia Satir

â€œBeing yourself is all it takes. If you want to impress someone don't be someone else just be yourself.â€

â€• Selena Gomez

â€œJust remember to always be yourself and donâ€™t be afraid to speak your mind or to dream out loudâ€

â€• J.A. Redmerski

â€œOne's philosophy is not best expressed in words; it is expressed in the choices one makes. In the long run, we shape our lives, and we shape ourselves. The process never ends until we die. And the choices we make are ultimately our own responsibilityâ€

â€• Eleanor Roosevelt

â€œThere are some values that you should never compromise on to stay true to yourself; you should be brave to stand up for what you truly believe in even if you stand alone.â€

â€• Roy T. Bennett

â€œPlants are more courageous than almost all human beings: an orange tree would rather die than produce lemons, whereas instead of dying the average person would rather be someone they are not.â€

â€• Mokokoma Mokhonoana

â€œHow many more of us are faking the facade? How many more of us are pretending to be something we're not? Even better, how many of us will have the courage to be ourselves regardless of what others think?â€

â€• Katie McGarry

â€œYour need for acceptance can make you invisible in this world. Don't let anything stand in the way of the light that shines through this form. Risk being seen in all of your glory.â€

â€• Jim Carrey

â€œNever apologize for burning too brightly or collapsing into yourself every night. That is how galaxies are made.â€

â€• Tyler Kent White

â€œAmid a world of noisy, shallow actors it is noble to stand aside and say, 'I will simply be.â€

â€• Henry David Thoreau

â€œBefore you can be anything, you have to be yourself. That's the hardest thing to find.â€

â€• E.L. Konigsburg

â€œBe yourself. Be true to that, to your heart. Patience. See what happens if you step back instead of bounding forward.â€

â€• Nora Roberts

â€œThose who have a strong sense of love and belonging have the courage to be imperfect.â€

â€• BrenÃ© Brown

â€œDon't wish to be normal. Wish to be yourself. To the hilt. Find out what you're best at, and develop it, and hopscotch your weaknesses. Wish to be great at whatever you are.â€

â€• Lois McMaster Bujold

â€œYou can't be yourself within jealousy.â€

â€• Toba Beta

â€œYouâ€™ll never know who you are unless you shed who you pretend to be.â€

â€• Vironika Tugaleva

â€œNothing can be more hurtful to your heart than betraying yourself.â€

â€• Roy T. Bennett

â€œBe yourself. Above all, let who you are, what you are, what you believe, shine through every sentence you write, every piece you finish.â€

â€• John Jakes

â€œWhether you try too hard to fit in or you try too hard to stand out, it is of equal consequence: you exhaust your significance.â€

â€• Criss Jami

â€œShe had blue skin. And so did he. He kept it hid, And so did she. They searched for blue Their whole life through, Then passed right by - And never knew.â€

â€• Shel Silverstein

â€œYou don't need to be like her. You're already everything.â€

â€• Mikki Daughtry

â€œStay true to yourself. An original is worth more than a copy.â€

â€• Suzy Kassem

â€œI looked for company and I found myself.â€

â€• Pushpa Rana

â€œIt is the chiefest point of happiness that a man is willing to be what he is.â€

â€• Erasmus

â€œDo not bend yourself to make others feel taller. When someone comes at you telling you what you are and slapping a label on you, simply ask them why. Why would you say that? Make THEM think.â€

â€• Rose McGowan

â€œYou don't have to be like them. You only have to be like you.â€

â€• Hiral Nagda

â€œThe world would be a much better place if they stopped congratulating themselves on being normal and started to accept that there were countless different normals.â€

â€• Talia Hibbert

â€œIf you really want to get along with somebody, let them be themselves.â€

â€• Willie Nelson

â€œPeople want so desperately to fit in that they forget what makes them stand out. Be loud. Take up space. Our differences are our strengths.â€

â€• Mickey Rowe

â€œRemain true. Stay focused on what you personally love. Align with what you are naturally drawn to. Believe in yourself and your own loves. Give what you have inside you. Give it bravely, and give it with good intent.â€

â€• Donna Goddard
